conclusion: Analyze forces on objects A and B using equilibrium conditions
Object A is suspended and object B is on the ground
Tension in rope OA equals weight of A, T_OA = 50 N
Forces on B include tension in OB and normal force
Vertical component of tension in OB equals weight of B, T_OB sin 45° = 100 N
Calculate T_OB = 100√2 N using vertical component equation
Horizontal component of tension in OB equals normal force, T_OB cos 45° = 100 N
Determine tensions in ropes: T_OA = 50 N, T_OB = 100√2 N
Final answer: Tensions are 50 N and 100√2 N
